name: Mas du Clos de l'Escarrat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I won't go on forever. Everythign that others have written is right on. We were a little concerned at first driving down the driveway of the Mas, but once the car stopped and Titus & August welcomed us, we felt at home. The rooms are spacious, comfortable beds. Bring a book for nights that you stay in unless you speak French and like French TV. There is very little in English in this area of Provance.
reviews.title: Just email them now and book it

reviews.text: My husband and I are California wine snobs and worried that the wine tour would be too elementary. But it was the best part of the trip. We were with a wonderful group, met some great vintners, and should have bought even more wine. (As it was we came home with nearly four cases -- we even declared it but didn't get stopped at customs) The wine is excellent and cheap by US standards, even if you get stuck paying for shipping and customs. Plus, the vintages soon to be released will be great in Chateauneuf and surrounding areas. The lunch and dinner that Andree presented was worth the cost alone. It's worth a lot more than they charge.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B with great accomodation

reviews.text: The pool is nice and clean, the surroundings are wonderful, Charles and Andree are great hosts. When we go back, there is no doubt where we'll stay.
reviews.title: Provence - Simply stunning!

reviews.text: We shopped two days in Avignon, which is about as close to a big city as you can get. They have great goodies and textiles to take home. A week may be a long time to stay there unless you have serious reading to catch up on. I'd say four days is pretty great; we did half the trip in Paris and it worked out very well. Never bored but not rushed, either.
reviews.title: A Totally Welcoming Experience in Provence

reviews.text: I can't comment on the wine tours like other here as I couldn't give a monkey's about wine, but this place is fabulous. The owners greeted us warmly - and made us feel right at home. The rooms we stayed in were in the grounds, and huge and quirky and clean and just felt 'right'.
reviews.title: This is where you want to stay in Provence

aka: Mas Du Clos De L'Escarrat Jonquieres, France - Provence
description: Located in Jonquières 6 miles from Orange antique theater, and 20 minutes only from Avignon in the heart of Popes's Provence and northern sunny Vaucluse, the Mas du Clos de l'Escarrat is a lovely old stone farm house, of typical Provençal style, which incorporates buildings dating back to the 17 th Century. This bed and breakfast has been carefully renovated to preserve its authentic, rustic character and charm, without compromising the need for modern comfort in all the accomodations. Breathtaking view over Ventoux Mount. Comfortable self-catering accommodations. Lots of tourism and visits in Provence. Beautiful landscapes and lavender fields in the Luberon area. These accommodations are located near Avignon, Chateauneuf du Pape. Tour the wine route with us and enjoy unforgettable wine tasting of Cotes du Rhone wines including the prestigious Chateauneuf du Pape.
